intro: Urostachys affinis, commonly known as the mountain rockrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Urostachys affinis is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
